meta.title: Welcome to the home page of this client-side XSLT framework documentation!
meta.description: This is the home page of a client-side XSLT framework documentation.

content.p: Takahē is a set of files which allows a web developer to put together a client-side site with all navigation in an external file. This site is both documentation of how to use Takahē, and a demonstration of what it can do.

Client-side is a little-used, but well supported, language which allows the content of a web page to be separated almost completely from the markup. It does not require JavaScript to workThe only JavaScript used on this site is to make the syntax highlighting in the code blocks work. It's done using the excellent highlight.js.
Even this tooltip is done without JavaScript..
If you view the source of this page, you'll see an file, which links off to files. The , JavaScript, navigation and surrounding template markup are all linked from these s.
